posts.name: Cody B.
posts.cooked: Hey all! just asking to hear some of your guys limelight video feed settings. My team is using a limelight, but we are having trouble getting an Apriltag reading unless we are RIGHT in front of them (be it source, amp, or speaker). This could be a result of lighting in our practice space, but it would also be nice to have a list of presets to be able to test and adjust, and would save us a lot of time in regards to having to find them ourselves. Thank you all!

posts.name: Barkın Var
posts.cooked:
It really depends on the environment. I guess learning what exposure and gain does and their effect on the video feed might help you understand how to dial them.

But most of the time you should try lower your gains and exposure if the lighting is sufficient. Since one lowers the motion blur and other helps to decrease noise.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
Heckboy:

trouble getting an Apriltag reading

What do you mean by that?

You can’t even detect the tag? Low resolution demands that you be near the tag. High resolution gives you more distance. The trade-off is speed.

Hard to believe your lighting is so dim the tag can’t be detected. If the image seems too dark to your eye but you can still see the tag squares then you are about right on the exposure and brightness. Cameras can see better than humans.

You can detect the tag but you don’t like the numbers? Not the real distance, angle, or pose? That’s a characteristic of the tags and is worse with a single tag and head on view. Many CD threads about needing filtering.

posts.name: Cody B.
posts.cooked: So, we are able to detect the tags in our practice space, but we have to be right up onto speaker (mostly referring to the Speaker Apriltags because that’s the main area of the field that we use them). For example, Apriltag ID8, which sits right in the center of the blue speaker, can only bee seen if we are head-on and maybe a foot away. If we ever find ourselves on the side of the speaker that is lacking an Apriltag, then we are pretty much out of luck. We’re gonna try adjusting the exposure and gain like the previous reply recommended, and go from there. We could always try to swap to a higher quality for lower speeds, but i fear that having lower speeds might also mean slightly long times to align (unless the differences are long term negligible. In which case, that might be the first thing we try)

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
Since you played a competition how were your tag detections at the event?

I suggest posting two screen shots of the LL dashboard just longer than the critical distance with no tag detection and just shorter than that point with a tag detection. Use WindowKey-Shift-S or WindowKey-PrintScreen and paste here.

Also post your vpr file.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked: How are the lighting conditions in the area that you are testing? At competitions, apriltags are almost always very well-lit. Aside from that, I recommend following the Quick Start for FRC AprilTags for finding the right settings for your limelight. Tracking AprilTags | Limelight Documentation

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
Heckboy:

Apriltag ID8, which sits right in the center of the blue speaker

Tag ID 8 is the left side of the blue speaker.
